title: Ticket #6381: getConsoleWindowSize() checks input rather than output
description:
condor_status calls getConsoleWindowSize() to determine both width and if its output is printed to a pipe but its ioctl() is run against stdin. This causes condor_status to misformat its output if it's piped into, rather than out of.

This code is duplicated in three other tools (_who, _q, and _history), who exclusively (erroneously?) care about width.
remarks:
2017-Aug-23 14:07:42 by tlmiller:
It looks like the callers in all but one place were already coded to allow for a negative return size. For that one place, I replaced the direct call at queue.cpp line 5489 to getConsoleWindowSize() with a call to an existing wrapper function that would return a default size if the width was actually negative.
